n.
10
128
Storing breastmilk
You can store breastmilk for:
• up	to	five	days	in	the	fridge	
at 4ºC or lower. This means 
putting the milk in the 
coolest part of the fridge, 
usually at the back (do not 
keep it in the door);
• up to two weeks in the 
freezer compartment of a 
fridge;
• up to six months in a 
domestic freezer, at -18ºC 
or lower.
Breastmilk must always be 
stored in a sterilised container. 
If you use a pump, make sure 
you wash it thoroughly after 
use and sterilise it before u
